title: Introducing: Gleemer
body:
New York’s **Gleemer** aka **Corey Coffman** has an element of Good Will Hunting about him.

Working at Atlantic Sound Studios in Brooklyn, Goffman recorded his debut release **_Death Sky, Soft Eye_** in the off-hours between work, I have this perception of **Gleemer** recording in the early hours of the morning, unintentionally leaving snippets of his music on the computers, hence the GWH comparison. Sadly, I have a feeling it’s maybe not quite that picturesque, still, for a debut release, it’s one of the strongest you’ll hear this year.

Ranging from the shoegaze drawl of _Breezy_ to the melancholic, Youth Lagoon-esque tinkle of _Honeybear_, it’s emotionally raw, whilst at times verging upon epic. Experimenting with a varied palette of sounds, **Gleemer** tries the upbeat (_Killing Machine_) and the more refined (_Bones_), succeeding each time in creating something wonderfully engaging. Personal highlight _Honeybear_ is a moving tribute to a lost lover, touching and beautifully bleak. The vocals are imperfect yet alluring, the production is spot-on, and the songwriting excels throughout; what else do you want? Check out Honeybear and Killing Machine below, and if that does it for you, then grab the full album below that.
